channel.title: sitespeed.io release feed
channel.description: New releases and changelog feed of sitespeed.io
channel.copyright: All rights reserved 2022, Peter Hedenskog and team

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated Browsertime with the new bidi-har that fixes the response har problem for Firefox #4589.

item.title: onlinetest 2.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Docker containers now uses NodeJS 24 #173.
  • German translations, thank you Tobi for PR #174.
  • Translations: Arabic, Bengali, Spanish, French, Hindi, Portuguese, Russian, Urdu, Simplified Chinese thank you Tobi for PR #181.
  • Basic Auth for admin now uses .env file and will warn in the logs if no auth is setup #205.

Fixed

  • Make sure the configuratiomn (nconf) is never accessed before configuration files is read #177.
  • Bump Postgres to latest version #172
  • Fix correct path to scripting file #167.
  • Update to sitespeed.io 39 #171.
  • Use Trixie as base image #185.
  • Simplify how we do releases #206
  • The webserver port was hardcoded, fixed in #204.
  • Renamed the default yaml files for server and testrunner #199

Changed

  • Rename defaulLocale configuration to locale #178. If you used localization:defaultLocale that is now localization:locale.
  • Updated minio to latest release. There are some changes on startup so check the PR and update your docker compose accordingly #163.
  • Switched to default use Redis instead of KeyDB since Redis is Open Source again #169.
  • Reworked the docker compose files #200 #202 #203
  • Always use .env if it exists for both the server and the testrunner (and the compose files) #190.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Chrome 144 and Firefox 147 in the Docker container #4582.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.3.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • There where something broken in Browsertime 26.3.0 together with the new bidi-har 0.0.20 for Firefox so I reverted to 0.0.18 until its been fixed with Browsertime/bidi-har #4579.

item.title: browsertime 26.3.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Reverting back to bidi-har 0.0.18. There where error/failures either in bidi har or in combination with browsertime in the latest release #2360

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Browsertime 26.3 with and updated version of bidi-har that makes it possible to get response bodies in the HAR file for Firefox #4578.

Fixed

  • Fixed typo in iteration detail page for the cpuConsumption metric, thank you Michael Walter for PR #4577.

item.title: browsertime 26.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Get response bodies in the HAR for Firefox. Thank you Julian Descottes and the rest of the Mozilla team that made this possible in bidi-har-export. Added in #2359. The Firefox HAR has missed this functionality since we did the switch to bidi-har.

Fixed

  • Restructure server timings so the timing name does not get lost for InfluxDB/Graphite. Thank you Tim Oldenburg for PR #2358.
  • Add Simpleperf app_profiler options and use --android.simpleperf. Thank you Abhishek Nimalan for PR #2352

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Browsertime 26.2 with latest Chromedriver and Edgedriver and a small XVFB fix #4575.

item.title: browsertime 26.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated Chromedriver and Edgedriver to 143 #2354 and#2355.
  • Updated webdriver to 4.39.0 #2356.

Fixed

  • Try to tune the XVFB handling to make it safer that xvfb is always stopped #2353.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix a bug introduced in 39.0.0 where alias was missing when creating some file structure #4574.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Safer handling for broken URLs. This logs the actual root cause #4573.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgrade the Docker container: Chrome and Edge 143, Firefox 146 #4572.

item.title: sitespeed.io 39.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgrade to support NodeJS 24 without warnings, include NodeJS 24 in the Docker container, and base the Docker container on Ubuntu 24.04. To make this work I needed to upgrade the Jimp library and then we lost the settings for png screenshots --browsertime.screenshotParams.png.compressionLevel #4570.

item.title: browsertime 26.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Firefox 146 in the Docker container #2351.
  • Chrome 143 in the Docker container #2350.

Fixed

  • Make sure the user in the Docker container has the correct user rights #2349.

item.title: browsertime 26.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Remove extra console.log entry :)

item.title: browsertime 26.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgrade to support NodeJS 24 without warnings, include NodeJS 24 in the Docker container, and base the Docker container on Ubuntu 24.04. To make this work I needed to upgrade the Jimp library and then we lost the settings for png screenshots --screenshotParams.png.compressionLevel #2342.

item.title: sitespeed.io 38.6.0
item.description:
Added

  • Browsertime 25.4.0 #4566.
  • Chrome 142 #4565.

item.title: browsertime 25.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Chrome and Chromedriver 142 #2335.

item.title: browsertime 25.3.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Better handling of closing XVFB #2332.
  • Firefox: Disable quicksuggest #2333.

item.title: onlinetest 1.7.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix for the search qyuery parameter #162.

item.title: onlinetest 1.7.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated dependencies (too many PRs).
  • Update to NodeJS 22 #155

item.title: browsertime 25.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Make it possible to strip cookie and auth headers in the HAR file for Firefox #2329 and Chrome #2330. Use --cleanSensitiveHeaders to remove a couple of headers.
  • Firefox 144 #2331.

Fixed

  • Updated developer dependencies #2326 and #2327.
  • Updated log dependency #2328

item.title: browsertime 25.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to Chrome/Chromedriver/Edge/Edgedriver 141, Firefox 143 #2325 and #2323.
  • Updated webdriver and bidi-har #2322.
  • Added simpleperf and perfetto support for Android, thank you Abhishek Nimalan for PR #2315.

item.title: coach-core 8.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Don't check svg images in avoidScalingImages check, thank you Marcus Müller for PR #129.
  • Add zstd to encoding check, thank you Marcus Müller for PR #128.
  • Make sure we use wappalyzer that is MIT #133.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • And another fix for script names #146.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • Another fix for showing the script name #145.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Show only the script name and not the full path #144.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • There was a bug that when you tried to change the URL after you edited a test with a script, you couldn't change the URL #142.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Another label fix.

item.title: onlinetest 1.6.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Guard against empty labels when changing labels #141.

item.title: coach-core 8.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix broken minified release.

item.title: coach-core 8.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Use latest data from https://github.com/enthec/webappanalyzer #114.
  • Use third part web 0.26.2 #113

Fixed

  • Update dev dependencies #115, #116 and #117.

item.title: chrome-har 1.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Try/catch broken dates #130.

item.title: chrome-har 1.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed dayjs dependency #128.
  • Removed uuid dependency #127.
  • Updated to tough cookie 5.0.0 #126.

item.title: throttle 5.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Smarter ifb0 handling on Linux #93.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.5
item.description:
Fixed

  • Always take care of Network.responseReceivedExtraInfo even if its fired early, thank you ifduyue for PR #120.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Include early hints requests, thank you Ben Schwarz for PR #118.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Another update to PageXray with a safer HTTP header check.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated PageXray.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.4
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added a safer header check #125.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • If the meta section from a HAR file from Browsertime was missing, we didn't catch that. Fixed in #124.
  • Update to latest minimist #122.

item.title: coach-core 8.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Expose third party web and wappalyzer versions #111.

Fixed

  • Updated to Wappalyzer 6.10.66 #110.
  • Updated third party web 0.24.0 #108.
  • Fix correct LCP attribute #107.

Changed

  • Remove advice about disableFLoCHeader #106.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated tough-cookie, thank you lallenlowe for PR #107.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Catch if local storage or session storage isn't accessible.

item.title: coach-core 7.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to third party web 0.23.0. #98.
  • Upgraded to latest wappalyzer #100.

Fixed

  • Make sure to skip advice if Chrome is missing FCP #95.
  • Update dev dependencies

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dependencies to latest versions #105.
  • Remove adding headers from extra parameters. Using the CDP Fetch API manipulating responses, the extra response info holds the old un-manipulated headers, so when copying the ones that do not exist, this breaks. Fixed in #100.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed exporting to work with ESM modules too.

item.title: throttle 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • Dropped support for NodeJS 12 since it's unmaintaned.

item.title: throttle 4.0.3
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fixed --version so it actually shows the version again #75.

item.title: throttle 4.0.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • The E6 Module convertion in 4.0 broke version check (--version) making installs failed. PR #74 is a temporaty fix for that.

item.title: throttle 4.0.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed the dependecy of route. Using ip route instead and we already have ip as a requirement.

item.title: coach-core 7.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PageXray 4.4.2 and Third Party Web 0.17.1.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Added missing SSL timings to the time per domain #117

item.title: throttle 3.1.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated minimist dependency.

item.title: throttle 4.0.0
item.description:
Fixed

  • Updated dev dependencies to latest versions #68

Changed

  • Converting the project to ES6 module. If you run Throttle by command line it will work exactly as before except that we dropped support for NodeJS 10 #67. You can read Sindre Sorhus ESM package guide.

item.title: pagexray 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Bumped minimist to 1.2.6

item.title: pagexray 4.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Fallback if mime types aren't mapped and use file endings. At the moment we fallback for some of the font types #109.

item.title: chrome-har 0.13.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add _isLinkPreload on the request object if it is isLinkPreload #94.

item.title: throttle 3.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Add support for setting packet loss. Add --packetLoss and set the loss in percentage.

item.title: coach 7.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Coach core and Browertime.

item.title: coach 6.4.3
item.description:
Added

  • Updated to use latest Browsertime with latest Chromedriver
  • Updated Docker container to use latest Chrome/Firefox
  • Use Browsertime 11.0.0
  • Use Coach-code 6.0
  • Use latest Firefox and Chrome

item.title: throttle 3.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • When you run on Mac OS we changed so localhost traffic is not throttled by default. To throttle on localhost use --localhost. This makes sence if you use WebDriver to drive your browser on your local machine. And Mac OS now works the same as Linux.

item.title: throttle 2.1.2
item.description:
Fixed

  • Fix breakage when multiple default routes are declared , thank you Andy Richardson for PR #62.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.1
item.description:
Added

  • Added missing in_body_parser_blocking render blocking info for Chrome.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Include request method per asset #105.

item.title: pagexray 4.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach info about render blocking assets coming/working in Chrome 92 #104.

item.title: pagexray 4.1.0
item.description:
Added

  • Attach Google Web Vitals data from Browsertime #101.

item.title: pagexray 4.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • The new header structure actually sucked. Instead follow other tools and flatten headers returning an array #98.

item.title: chrome-har 0.11.12
item.description:
Fixed

  • Removed test directory from the release, thank you Yury Michurin for the PR #75.

item.title: coach 5.0.0
item.description:
Changed

  • We moved out the core functionality to coach-core. This makes it easy to use the Coach in your own code.

item.title: coach 4.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to Browsertime 8.0.1

item.title: humble 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Updated throttle frontend to latest version where you can see throttling profiles set by using the API and with custom throttling support.

item.title: compare 1.0.0
item.description:
Added

  • Added support for using Github gists see #34.
  • Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test.
  • Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id.
  • Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync.
  • Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this.
  • Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.

Changed

  • New internal structure and use the new configuration object all the way.

item.title: compare 0.6.0
item.description:
Added

  • Sort CPU events by name to make it easier to spot regressions
  • Upgraded to latest release of template7
  • Added more Visual Metrics.
  • Upgrad to PageXray 2.4.0

item.title: compare 0.5.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Layout -> Rendering in latest Browsertime.
  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.5.2 fixiing Edge tab bug

item.title: compare 0.5.0
item.description:
Added

  • CPU metrics are now showed automatically.
  • Styled the PageXray info table to make it easier to read.

item.title: compare 0.4.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Major code refactoring to make it easier to do changes in the future.
  • Uploading files failed on Firefox.

item.title: compare 0.4.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.4.1
  • You can change/upload HAR files when you already compare two HARs.

Fixed

  • The layout in the PageXray table was dependent of the length of the URL. That could make some pages look really bad.

item.title: compare 0.3.0
item.description:
Added

  • Automatically load the HAR files if both files are given in the URL . Thanks Ivru for the PR #15.
  • You can automatically load one HAR file by adding ?har1=URL&compare=1 as the full URL.
  • Updated to PageXray 2.2.1
  • You can now drag and drop one HAR file with multiple pages and compare the pages with each others #16.

item.title: compare 0.2.1
item.description:
Fixed

  • Upgraded to PerfCascade 2.2.2 that makes HAR files from WebPageTest Linux render
  • Log errors to the console

item.title: compare 0.2.0
item.description:
Added

  • Upgraded to PageXray 2.1.0 and added more CPU metrics
